chineseMeaning: v. 违反；相抵触；否定;
examples: Her actions contravene the rules.
This evidence contravenes our theory.

chineseMeaning: adj. 不听命令的；顽固的；拒不服从的;
v. 渐渐康复；渐愈;
adj. 可仿效的；模范的;
examples: Saintly individuals who lead exemplary lives imbue their environments with the holiness that accrues from their spiritual practices.

chineseMeaning: vt. 使高兴；使愉快；使振奋;
adj. 紧急的；迫切的；急需的;
examples: Building resource-conserving society was an exigent mission.
To explain the current tense physician-patient relationship is an exigent social problem.

chineseMeaning: n. 慌乱；狼狈；混乱; v. 使酩醉；慌张；混乱;
examples: People fluster ground leaves ship, the woman went up above all with children Immanuel gives birth to a boat.

chineseMeaning: n. 钝头剑；箔；陪衬物；（击剑运动用的）花剑; vt. 挫败；击退；阻挠;
examples: The foil is a thrusting weapon with no cutting edge.
Our foil packets seal the flavour in.
Aluminum foil can be used for wrapping food.
This box of chocolate was wrapped round with foil.
In the play, a wicked old uncle acts as a foil to the noble young prince.
In foil and saber,only the attacking fencer can score a point.

chineseMeaning: adj. 不会错的；极简单的；可靠而操作简便的；傻瓜式的;
examples: No system can ever be completely foolproof.
They adopted a foolproof identification system.

chineseMeaning: n. 丈夫;
examples: My husband is a stamp collector.
Mary accused her husband of snore too loudly.

chineseMeaning: adj. 声音沙哑的；强壮的; n. 哈士奇；爱斯基摩狗；强壮的人;
examples: The teacher speaks with a husky voice.
I'm still a bit husky after the recent cold.
A husky sergeant opened the car door.

chineseMeaning: adj. 不妥协性的; n. 不妥协的人;
examples: They promoted an intransigent revolutionary strategy.
He can be intransigent and pigheaded at times.

chineseMeaning: vt. 欺骗；激起 ... 的兴趣; vi. 密谋; n. 阴谋；私通；复杂的事;
examples: The shapes of clouds intrigue me.

chineseMeaning: n. 鞭子；鞭打；睫毛；讽刺; v. 鞭打；摆动；抨击;
examples: By rod and lash, the boy was punished.
The pirate captain beat his crew with a lash.
With a lash of its tail the tiger leaped at her.
She darkens her lash and blushes
The lash of public opinion compelled him to resign.

chineseMeaning: adj. 潜伏的；潜在的;
examples: He was infected with a latent infection.
We must take measures to control the latent disease germs.
Within everyone there was a latent volcano of unhappiness and discontent.
The latent cause of crime is often avarice.
The manager did not find her latent abilities.
The now responsibilities drew out his latent talents.

chineseMeaning: adj. 赞美的；赞赏的;
examples: Sometime I can hear the laudatory words, sometime I can meet the random railer.

chineseMeaning: vt. 使混合；使结合; vi. 交往；联合；混在一起;
examples: You can not mingle oil and water .
She accepted the money with mingled feelings.
The two rivers mingle their waters here.

chineseMeaning: n. 小写字; adj. 小写字的；很小的;
examples: This manuscript was written in a minuscule script.
If the plane has empty seats,the cost of adding one more passenger is minuscule.

chineseMeaning: n. (疾病周期性)发作；(感情)爆发;
examples: The smoking will raise the cancer paroxysm outbreak rate.
He went into a paroxysm of rage for what happened.

chineseMeaning: v. 挡开武器或打击；挡开；回避; n. 挡开；回避;
examples: He prefers to parry rather than duck and sway.
The bad news is that the U.N. is too weak to parry this challenge.
Mrs Clinton finds this hard to parry.

chineseMeaning: adj. 不完全的；部分的；偏袒的；偏爱的;
examples: around three
The research project was only a partial success.
His partial attitude called forth a lot of criticism.
Don't be partial to your own child.
I'm very partial to sweet foods.

chineseMeaning: adj. 偏袒的；党派性的; n. 强烈支持者；党羽；游击队员;
examples: You must listen to both points of view and try not to be partisan.
The other obstacle is partisan bickering.

chineseMeaning: vt.  使极化； 使 ... 偏振化； 使 ... 两极分化; vi.  形成极化;
adj. 擦亮的；精练的；优美的;  动词polish的过去式和过去分词.;
examples: I read her name on the polished brass plate.
The children loved sliding round the newly polished floor.
It's an honest book but it hasn't been polished.
The attorney's final argument was very polished and powerful.
